content: What 1997 film directed by James Cameron became the first to gross over $1 billion worldwide?

I think I know the answer to this! So, the question is about a film directed by James Cameron in 1997 that made more than a billion dollars worldwide. Let me think for a second. James Cameron is a really famous director known for big blockbuster movies. One of his most famous films is "Titanic." That came out in 1997, right?

Wait, was "Titanic" released in 1997? I think so. And I've heard that it was incredibly successful at the box office. In fact, I believe it was the highest-grossing film for quite some time after its release. So, if it made over a billion dollars worldwide, that would make sense.

But to be sure, maybe I should double-check the release year of "Titanic." Let me think. James Cameron started working on "Titanic" in the early 1990s, and I think it was released towards the end of the decade. Yes, 1997 sounds right.

Now, was it the first film to gross over $1 billion worldwide? I seem to recall that before "Titanic," no film had reached that milestone. "Titanic" was a monumental success, both critically and commercially. It broke box office records and held the title for highest-grossing film for a number of years until other films like "Avatar," which is also directed by James Cameron, surpassed it.

But in this case, the question specifies 1997 and James Cameron. Given that "Titanic" fits both criteria and was a massive global hit, I'm confident that's the answer.

Another way to look at it is to consider other films from 1997 directed by James Cameron. But, to my knowledge, "Titanic" is the only film he directed that year. So, it makes sense that it's the one being referred to here.

Moreover, the milestone of grossing over $1 billion worldwide is significant in Hollywood history, and "Titanic" is often credited as the first film to achieve that. So, all signs point to "Titanic" being the answer.

Just to cover all bases, perhaps there were other films around that time that came close, but I don't think any had surpassed the billion-dollar mark before "Titanic." For example, "Jurassic Park" was another huge success, but I believe it was released in 1993 and didn't reach that milestone.

Therefore, I can conclude with confidence that the 1997 film directed by James Cameron that became the first to gross over $1 billion worldwide is "Titanic."

**Final Answer**

\[ \boxed{\text{Titanic}} \]
